Description: Identifies and describes the subset of body of knowledge of software engineering that is generally accepted
Establishes a common framework for describing the life cycle of systems created by humans and defines a set of processes and associated terminology
Establishes a common framework for software life cycle processes with well-defined terminology
Specifies requirements for the service provider to plan, establish, implement, operate, monitor, review, maintain, and improve a service management system (SMS)
Provides overall information on the concepts of process assessment and its use in the two contexts of process improvement and process capability determination
Addresses the creation, analysis, and sustainment of architectures of systems through the use of architecture descriptions
Introduces the characteristics and requirements of a VSE and clarifies the rationale for VSE-specific profiles, documents, standards, and guides
Provides external metrics for measuring attributes of six external quality characteristics defined in ISO/IEC 9126-1

Provides:  An introduction and motivation for ODP An overview of the Reference Model of Open Distributed Processing (RM-ODP) and an explanation of its key concepts Gives guidance on the application of RM-ODP
Establishes a baseline for an integrated set of processes for Software Assessment Management (SAM), divided into tiers to allow for incremental implementation, assessment, and recognition

Title: Systems and software engineering  Requirements for managers of user documentation
Description: Specifies procedures for managing user documentation throughout the software life cycle.

Title: Systems and software engineering -- Requirements for acquirers and suppliers of user documentation
Description: Defines the documentation process from the acquirer's standpoint and the supplier's standpoint.

Title: Systems and software engineering  Requirements for testers and reviewers of user documentation
Description: Defines the process in which user documentation products are tested.

Title: Systems and software engineering  Requirements for designers and developers of user documentation
Description: Specifies the structure, content, and format for user documentation, and provides informative guidance for user documentation style.

Title: Systems and software engineering  Developing user documentation in an agile environment
Description: Specifies the way in which user documentation can be developed in agile development projects.
